items.name: case easeInOut
items.desc: An ease-in ease-out curve causes the animation to begin slowly, accelerate through the middle of its duration, and then slow again before completing. This is the default curve for most animations.

items.name: case easeIn
items.desc: An ease-in curve causes the animation to begin slowly, and then speed up as it progresses.

items.name: case easeOut
items.desc: An ease-out curve causes the animation to begin quickly, and then slow down as it completes.

items.name: case linear
items.desc: A linear animation curve causes an animation to occur evenly over its duration.
